title: Ellie Goulding and Little Mix lead the glamour as stars arrive for BRIT Awards 2017
text:
Ellie Goulding and Little Mix lead the glamour as stars arrive for BRIT Awards 2017 The ceremony starts from 7.30pm on ITV   Share   Comments By Lara Martin 16:44, 22 FEB 2017 Updated 17:14, 22 FEB 2017 TV (Photo: Rex Features)   Share   Comments Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Ellie Goulding and Little Mix were among the first stars to arrive for tonight's BRIT Awards 2017.
Although the music extravaganza doesn't actually begin until 7.30pm, the celebrities have started to walk the red carpet at London's O2 Arena.
Ellie was among the first to arrive, looking stunning in a sexy black dress with an Angelina Jolie-esque thigh split, while Little Mix wowed in their glamorous gowns.
Ellie looked fabulous (Photo: Rex Features) She was the first to arrive at the O2 (Photo: Rex Features) The Little Mix girls looked amazing (Photo: Rex Features) Ellie is nominated for Best Female Solo Artist, while Little Mix have scored nods for Best British Group and Best British Single for Shout Out To My Ex.
Also arriving early was Ed Sheeran, looking dapper in his all black ensemble. He's performing tonight.
Craig David, James Arthur and Xtra Factor co-host Roman Kemp have also arrived ahead of a night which promises to be must-watch TV, featuring a slew of huge performances and a special mystery tribute to George Michael.
(Photo: PA) Read More What time are the Brit Awards 2017? Nominees, performers, how to watch and who is hosting As ever, fans in the UK can watch all the action on ITV with an exclusive broadcast, while Clara Amfo, Laura Jackson and Alice Levine will host live from the red carpet and backstage either side of the main show on ITV2.
However, that's not all - the BRITs will also air live on YouTube at 7.30pm, which will be fronted by the platform's presenter-in-chief Casper Lee. 
Craig David is a nominee (Photo: PA) James Arthur's also nominated (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in  How to watch The Brit Awards 2017 Share this video Watch Next Geoff Taylor, chief executive of the BPI & BRIT Awards said: "We are always looking for ways for The BRITs to reach as wide an audience as possible given the global interest and huge international artists taking part in the show.
"It’s really exciting for us that so many people around the world will get the chance to celebrate the UK’s biggest night in music live as it happens.”
Dermot O'Leary and Emma Willis will replace Michael Buble at the helm of this year's glitzy presentation.
The Canadian crooner pulled out of hosting following the tragic news that his three-year-old son had been diagnosed with liver cancer.
Rag 'N' Bone Man arrives at the O2 (Photo: Rex Features) Biffy Clyro making their entrance (Photo: PA) Read More BRIT Awards: The best EVER moments - from weird accents to falling over and everything else in between Mum of three, Emma said: “Every part of me sends so much love and all the best wishes in the world to Michael and his family at such a difficult time.
“I’m a huge fan of his and I would have relished watching him present the Brits. I know everyone involved wants to make the best show possible and I hope we do him proud.”
The BRITs will host exciting performances from some of the biggest names in the world.
Clean Bandit's Grace Chatto (Photo: PA) Talia Storm (Photo: PA) Singer songwriter Ed Sheeran continues his amazing comeback as he takes to the stage, while Robbie Williams, Little Mix and Emeli Sandé will also be performing.
They'll be joined by Katy Perry, Bruno Mars, The 1975 and grime sensation Skepta.
